title: Student-Centered English Teaching Methodology (TEFL) Microlearning for 21st-Century Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English Communication Skills and Job-Related Fundamental Vocabulary
context.additional_context: Conducted in corporate settings with digital device provision, involving 10-minute modular learning via mobile apps and collaborative projects

learning_goals: Learners can achieve over 80% accuracy in practical document writing and presentations by utilizing situational business English expressions.
Learners can demonstrate critical thinking skills through online discussions and feedback exchanges with peer learners using collaboration tools.
Self-directed learning and communication competencies can be assessed through project-based task performance on a digital collaboration platform.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
